alert.note: Alert for Northern and Central Idaho Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 22 at 7:04AM MDT until July 25 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND DRY CONDITIONS MONDAY... .A cold front will approach Monday afternoon and sweep through Monday night. Southwest winds will increase through the day becoming gusty Monday afternoon and evening with gusts of 25 to 30 mph. Temperatures Monday afternoon will climb into the upper 80s with RH values near 20%. There is a very small chance (5%) for dry lightning Monday morning then a 10-15% chance for sprinkles with the frontal passage Monday night. Gusty winds and dry conditions will continue on Tuesday with temperatures cooling into the 70s to lower 80s. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR IDAHO PANHANDLE...FOOTHILLS OF NORTHEAST WASHINGTON...EASTERN COLUMBIA BASIN INCLUDING PALOUSE AND SPOKANE AREA...AND LOWER PALOUSE - SNAKE RIVER... The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Monday afternoon through Monday evening. * Affected Area: Fire Weather Zone 101 Northern and Central Idaho Panhandle (Zone 101), Fire Weather Zone 701 Foothills of Northeast Washington (Zone 701), Fire Weather Zone 708 Eastern Columbia Basin -Palouse -Spokane Area (Zone 708) and Fire Weather Zone 709 Lower Palouse -Snake River (Zone 709). * Winds: Southwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Relative Humidities: 17 to 25 percent. * Impacts: Any new and existing fires have the potential to spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
